result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter J Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
No sentence credit if revoked from probation.
Case 22CF167 is dismissed and read in.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
Undergo AODA assessment (within 30 days) and follow through with recommendations.

Complete an evidence-based domestic violence assessment (within 30 days) and follow through with any recommendations.  
Comply with any other assessments, programming, and conditions per agent.  
The Defendant is to submit to random UA's and PBT's.  
Maintain absolute sobriety.

No contact with victim, K.O., unless she and the agent approve in writing.  
No use or possession of any alcohol.  
No entry into any bars, taverns, or establishments where the primary business is the sale of alcohol.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending further order of the Court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter J Olson

records.addlTxt:
(Case called at 3:57 PM)
 Defendant Peter J Olson appeared by video with Attorney Scott S. Schlough.
Attorney Schlough provides update as to the Defendant's progress on the domestic abuse assessment and treatment. Attorney Schlough to forward a copy of the DV Assessment to the judicial assistant.
Probation review hearing on October 26, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Time to Pay Summary mailed to Defendant
Judge Vlack's Sentencing Conditions Checklist

(Cases called at 9:07 AM - 22CF167 and 22CM377)
Defendant Peter Olson appears in Eau Claire County courtroom with Attorney Scott Schlough.  Attorney Megan Kelly appears in Eau Claire County courtroom for the State of Wisconsin.
Judge and court reporter appear via Zoom video from St. Croix County courthouse.  State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Victim appears via Zoom.  State outlines the agreement for the Court.  Defendant acknowledges the Plea Questionnaire and is advised of his Constitutional rights.  Defendant enters plea of No Contest to Count 1 in 22CM377.  Court will not accept a No Contest plea.  Defendant enters plea of Guilty to Count 1 in 22CM377.   Court accepts plea and finds Defendant guilty.  22CF167 is dismissed and read in.  
Court orders that sentence be withheld and Defendant be placed on probation for 1 year with the following conditions: 90 days in jail, stayed pending further order of the Court.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Undergo AODA assessment (within 30 days) and follow through with recommendations.  Complete an evidence-based domestic violence assessment (within 30 days) and follow through with any recommendations.  Comply with any other assessments, programming, and conditions per agent.  No contact with victim, K.O., unless she and the agent approve in writing.  No use or possession of any alcohol.  No entry into any bars, taverns, or establishments where the primary business is the sale of alcohol.  The Defendant is to submit to random UA's and PBT's.  The Defendant is ordered to appear in court on October 26, 2022 at 3:45 PM (counsel need not appear) via Zoom to review compliance with conditions of probation.
Elements of the Offense - Bail Jumping
Settlement Proposal

(Cases called at 10:18 AM - 22CF167 and 22CM377) 
Defendant Peter Olson appears with Attorney Scott Schlough via videoconference.  Attorney Megan Kelly appears for the State of Wisconsin via Zoom videoconference.
Defense has received all of the discovery and advises that there is an agreement in these cases.  
Plea Hearing: July 26, 2022 at 9:00 AM (Parties in person in Branch 6 - Eau Claire County; Judge/Court Reporter via Zoom; victim may appear in person or by Zoom)
K.M.O.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection

(Cases called at 1:06 PM - 22CF167 and 22CM377)  Hearing held via Zoom video application.
Defendant Peter Olson appears with Attorney Scott Schlough via videoconference.  Attorney Megan Kelly appears for the State of Wisconsin via videoconference.
Defense has received the new complaint (22CM377) - waives reading and stands mute as to the charges, but requests a hearing on both cases be scheduled.  Defendant advised of the charges in 22CM377, as well as his Constitutional rights.  Court enters Not Guilty plea on Defendant's behalf.  Defense requests 4-6 weeks before the next hearing.  Signature bond set in 22CM377 will be mailed to Defendant.
